item.title: Re: weirdest question in BvS
item.content:encoded: An easy way to look at it is this: Levels are dice. 20 levels equals 20 dice. 20 levels plus 20 bonus levels equals 20 dice normally plus 20 bonus dice. Strength is a modifier you add to each die roll after you roll. Range is the number of sides each die has. Thus a 10 levels, 10 range, 5 strength player would roll 10 10-sided dice and add 5 to each roll; The only caveat is that a bonus cannot go over the total number of sides, making range the most important attribute, as a difficulty set higher than your range makes it impossible to beat. Thus, if you rolled 3,3,4,5,7,7,2,1,9 you would end up with 8,8,9,10,10,10,7,6,10.

item.title: Re: weirdest question in BvS
item.content:encoded:
To pass a 35/35 check you need:

  1. Range 35 at the barest minimum
  2. A combination of Levels plus Successes of at least 35

Technically that's it. More is better of course, the chances of you passing this check with only 35 levels and range is infinitesimal. Technically, you can do this without any strength at all, but practically that is just this side of impossible.

item.title: Re: weirdest question in BvS
item.content:encoded: so, its like an odds modifier? I ask, because i have all the range/str i need in Gen to obtain the 35/35 checks in R00t, but i get 10s a lot, and wondered if levels have anything to do with it

item.title: Re: weirdest question in BvS
item.content:encoded:
You can have +100 Strength, Range 200 but if the mission requires 35 successes you'll need at least 35 levels or 35 successes (Much more hard).

With crank 30, a AA-Rank mission may have 55 successes required.

item.title: Re: weirdest question in BvS
item.content:encoded:
Recompiling: Strength and Successes are expensive. It usually works out that raising your levels and range will increases your odds/Core Spent more than Strength and Successes. It worked out fairly close for me that I wanted 2 Range and Levels for every one Strength and Success I recompiled.

Missions: Recompiling does nothing for missions and it is impossible to get very many successes, so you have to make up the difference in levels.

item.title: weirdest question in BvS
item.content:encoded: Levels in BvS. What are they for, exactly? in R00t, you can buy levels, but what do they do in missions and in r00t? why not just go heavy in strength, range, and successes?
